title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki - XWiki
content:
01:00 <xenon75> has quit  
03:26 <pturcotte> has joined #xwiki  
05:25 <DrLou> has quit  
06:16 <xwikibot> has joined #xwiki  
07:00 <Denis1> has joined #xwiki  
07:03 <Denis> has quit  
07:11 <npm\_> has joined #xwiki  
07:12 <npm> has quit  
07:20 <sdumitriu> has quit  
07:36 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
07:48 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
07:57 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
08:46 <vmassol> good morning  
08:46 <vmassol> hmm myxwiki.org is down  
08:47 <vmassol> for some reason it's not restartong  
08:49 <vmassol> restarting it for now  
08:50 <vmassol> ok I see a Caused by: java.io.IOException: Cannot create directory: /usr/local/work/lucene n the logs  
08:51 <vmassol> hmm the lucene dir is not set up  
08:55 <vmassol> ok fixed for lucene index  
08:56 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
08:58 <vmassol> continuing with xwiki.org upgrade now  
09:11 <vmassol> going to remove spam users on xwiki.org  
09:16 <Denis1> is now known as <Denis>  
09:32 <jvdrean> has joined #xwiki  
09:59 <vmassol> guys is there a good reason that the AS doesn't display in preview mode?  
10:01 <sburjan> has joined #xwiki  
10:08 <+tmortagne> vmassol: a if ? :)  
10:08 <vmassol> if?  
10:09 <+tmortagne> if (action != 'preview')  
10:09 <+tmortagne> don't listen to me  
10:09 <vmassol> i'll ask raluca  
10:13 <vmassol> seems to work lcoally on 3.2snap  
10:13 <vmassol> but not on xwiki.org 3.1.1  
10:14 <vmassol> actually it does work but  
10:14 <vmassol> it says "there are no activities"  
10:16 <vmassol> anyway since it works in 3.2, forget it  
10:16 <vmassol> sorry for the noise  
10:28 <vmassol> myxwikiorg restart by itself  
10:28 <vmassol> so soon....  
10:34 <qwebirc92154> has joined #xwiki  
10:35 <qwebirc92154> hy there, I have a problem with Xwiki  
10:35 <qwebirc92154> we tried to import and .odt (Open Office) document  
10:35 <qwebirc92154> and it crashed Xwiki  
10:35 <qwebirc92154> now every page we try to access is a blank page  
10:36 <qwebirc92154> we did a "clear cookies" in the browser after finding a similar thread on the mailing list  
10:36 <qwebirc92154> and we only get the HTML, but no styles ...  
10:38 <qwebirc92154> also, the response time is high ...  
10:38 <qwebirc92154> and now, when we try to access WebHome, it sends us to Login  
10:38 <qwebirc92154> so something pretty much crashed the XWiki hard  
11:16 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
11:22 <+sburjan> hello. I am testing RC1, but I don't see where are the workspaces  
11:22 <+tmortagne> sburjan: it's not packaged with XE  
11:23 <+sburjan> so it's just a platform app, that's all ?  
11:24 <+sburjan> ok, I won't test it now if it's not packaged  
11:29 <qwebirc92154> has quit  
11:32 <Enygma`> has quit  
11:34 <sburjan> has quit  
11:35 <sburjan> has joined #xwiki  
11:44 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
11:48 <+tmortagne> sburjan: yes it just happen to be part of the platfom like ruby macro  
12:07 <vmassol> sburjan: it needs to be tested sine a lot of stuff are in the platform  
12:07 <vmassol> Enygma` needs to tell us how to test it  
12:07 <vmassol> it's also in teh release notes and thus is released and needs to be tested  
12:08 <+Enygma`> I`m guessing you`re talking about workspaces :)  
12:11 <vmassol> Enygma`: sorin was saying: "hello. I am testing RC1, but I don't see where are the workspaces"  
12:11 <vmassol> can you help me him test the feature?  
12:12 <+sburjan> vmassol: shouldn't testing RC1 a priority now ?  
12:13 <vmassol> sburjan: I don't understand the question  
12:13 <+sburjan> when is the final release date for 3.2 ?  
12:13 <vmassol> RC1 is supposed to be the last release before final so yes it's important it's good enough to be released  
12:13 <+sburjan> I should focus on testing RC1 now  
12:14 <vmassol> sburjan: http://enterprise.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/Roadmap  
12:14 <vmassol> (ie next Monday)  
12:18 <jvdrean> has quit  
12:18 <+Enygma`> ok vmassol, give me a few minutes  
12:18 <+sburjan> Tomowwor I won't be avaiable on platform, so I'm starting to test RC1 now  
12:53 <jvdrean> has joined #xwiki  
12:59 <mflorea> has quit  
13:51 <DrLou> has joined #xwiki  
13:56 <pturcotte> has quit  
14:02 <DrLou> has quit  
14:04 <DrLou> has joined #xwiki  
14:07 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
14:33 <pturcotte> has joined #xwiki  
14:34 <vmassol> Enygma`: there's no bundle information for http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Workspace+Application  
14:34 <vmassol> ah wait it's correct  
14:34 <vmassol> it's not bundled right?  
14:35 <vmassol> (there's a screenshot todo btw on http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Workspace+Application )  
14:49 <+tmortagne> vmassol: yes it's not bundled  
14:49 <vmassol> ok  
14:49 <vmassol> same for the component?  
14:49 <+tmortagne> AFAIK yes  
14:49 <vmassol> ok  
14:50 <+tmortagne> it's just in platform like ruby macro basically for now  
14:59 <Denis> has quit  
15:06 <vmassol> Enygma`: so the workspace feature is unusable in 3.2RC1?  
15:06 <vmassol> (just seen your commit)  
15:07 <vmassol> ok seen the jira now  
15:07 <vmassol> (which confirms what I thought...)  
15:07 <+Enygma`> yes vmassol... my mistake obviously :|  
15:07 <vmassol> that's a lesson for not having tests….  
15:07 <vmassol> Enygma`: can you please update the Release notes for 3.2RC1  
15:07 <vmassol> ?  
15:08 <+Enygma`> well, yes, but what should I say? that it's actually available from 3.2 final?  
15:09 <+Enygma`> in a warning macro?  
15:09 <vmassol> yes to both  
15:09 <vmassol> but we need some tests to prove that it works  
15:10 <vmassol> (maybe manual for now but automated as soon as the app is in the platform)  
15:11 <+Enygma`> I did some manual testing, obviously... but I rushed with the final changes and did not get to test it all over.  
15:11 <+Enygma`> anyway, will be more carefull  
15:11 <vmassol> in practice we should refuse any commit that odesn't have automated tests  
15:12 <vmassol> it's degrading our quality level and not following our practices, it's also preventing others devs to touch the code  
15:12 <vmassol> (since you're too worried about breaking something without tests)  
15:12 <vmassol> it's also reducing our global TPC score  
15:13 <vmassol> (not jsut commenting for you eddy, but for all of us)  
15:13 <+Enygma`> of course  
15:13 <vmassol> I think we've been very lenient on tests lately  
15:22 <vmassol> Enygma`: you're ready for politics…:)   " incomplete transfer process"…. wtf?  ;)  
15:22 <+Enygma`> well, I did call it a bug at the end :)  
15:22 <vmassol> yeah  
15:23 <+Enygma`> and it was a... transfer process :)  
15:23 <+Enygma`> anyway :P  
15:25 <vmassol> evalica: need some help understanding why the AS is displayed below instead of to the right on xwiki.org, for ex: http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/XWiki/VincentMassol  
15:26 <vmassol> (note: I haven't checked if it's a problem of 3.1.1 but on 3.1 it doesn't do this, nor on 3.2)  
15:26 <+Enygma`> so, about sorin`s request, it should be testable now, if the snapshot build of the component is used instead of the RC1 version.  
15:47 <Denis> has joined #xwiki  
16:19 <+evalica> vmassol: fixed  
16:30 <vmassol> evalica: thanks!  
16:31 <vmassol> so I guess it was xwikiorg issue and not a general one, cool  
16:32 <+evalica> yes ... it was a rule I defined  
16:35 <vmassol> k  
17:00 <sdumitriu> has joined #xwiki  
17:05 <sburjan> has quit  
17:51 <vmassol> Enygma`: we now have a scm macro to use on xwiki.org  
17:51 <vmassol> http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Macros/SCM  
17:54 <+Enygma`> so it's hardcoded to use github?  
17:55 <vmassol> the idea is that when we swtich scm we don't have to change the links  
17:55 <+Enygma`> I see  
17:55 <+Enygma`> ok, will use it  
17:55 <+tmortagne> Enygma`: right now yes the only hardcoded part is http://github.com/ basically  
17:56 <+tmortagne> but the main idea was that you use this and if ever we move xwiki elsewhere you don't have to change the page  
17:56 <+tmortagne> just the macro  
17:56 <+Enygma`> yep, makes sense  
17:57 <+tmortagne> need to make the first part configurable instead of in the code to be able to publish it in extension.xwiki.org as a generic scm macro  
17:57 <+tmortagne> sometime...  
17:58 <vmassol> don't wait too much or you'll never do it :)
